posts.name: Noah Gagne
posts.cooked: Does anyone know how to calculate the focal length of a camera or know the focal vertical and horizontal lengths and the vertical and horizontal focal center of the Microsoft LiveCam HD-3000 in pixels?

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
By using chiefdelphi’s search feature, I found a few threads that might be relevant. I searched for microsoft focal length and microsoft fov.

Determining object distance using Microsoft Lifecam HD3000 Technical

Focal Length of Microsoft Lifecam Technical Discussion

Lifecam HD-3000 specifications (horizontal and vertical FOV)? Technical

Horizontal FOV of Microsoft Lifecam Cinema Programming

link_counts.title: Determining object distance using Microsoft Lifecam HD3000
Horizontal FOV of Microsoft Lifecam Cinema
Lifecam HD-3000 specifications (horizontal and vertical FOV)?

posts.name: Noah Gagne
posts.cooked: Thank you for your help but the threads don’t have the focal lengths in pixels, its in degrees. Do you have any idea how to find it?

posts.name: Peter
posts.cooked:
You should look into Camera Calibration. You can calibrate the camera yourself by taking pictures of a checkerboard pattern and using OpenCV to calculate the distortion. This is a handy tutorial if you’re interested.

It looks like the creators of PhotonVision have already calculated the calibration data for the LifeCam at 320x240 ( here ) and 640x480 ( here ). This data is formatted as a matrix,

\begin{bmatrix}f_x&0&c_x\\ 0&f_y&c_y\\ 0&0&1\end{bmatrix}

Where f_x and f_y are the focal lengths, and c_x and c_y are the coordinates of the principal point. These values are measured in pixels, so they are relative to the frame resolution.

I hope this helps!

posts.name: Noah Gagne
posts.cooked: That helped a lot, thank very much for your time and effort!
